TopicTitle: Why are payload trusses heavier than cargo bays with doors?

Articles.Content: A  cargo bay with doors has a full metal skin, actuators, all sorts of clever gubbins. A payload truss is just a bunch of steel pipes welded together. What gives?

Oh there are numerous inconsistencies with mass.  Certainly from different developers.  The XL Cargo NoseCone with motors to move it is only around ~1.5t, where as the AeroDynamic XL Nose cone is a whopping +5t.
I noticed this when building a Jool mothership. The cargo bays are way more efficient than the lightweight semi-trusses.
